item.title:
RT by @SamuelMarcLowe: New at THE OVERSHOOT:
Russia Sanctions Update: April (comprehensive) and May (preliminary)
https://theovershoot.co/p/russia-sanctions-update-april-comprehensive
<-- the squeeze is still on, especially if you focus on dual-use goods

item.title: RT by @SamuelMarcLowe: Prior to the pandemic, most people didn't give much thought to supply chains unless they were in the industry. That has changed over the past 2.5 years. We’re sharing a list of 55 logistics, supply chain & global trade experts we recommend you follow: https://www.flexport.com/blog/55-supply-chain-and-logistics-experts-you-should-follow-on-social/?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=supply-chain-experts&utm_content=220629
item.dc:creator: @flexport
item.description: Prior to the pandemic, most people didn't give much thought to supply chains unless they were in the industry. That has changed over the past 2.5 years. We’re sharing a list of 55 logistics, supply chain & global trade experts we recommend you follow: flexport.com/blog/55-supply-…

item.title: R to @DoctorT1992: Don’t object to principle that trusted traders can be treated differently (has proposed something similar but called an express lane) — disagree on what benefits will be, UK wants next to no controls; EU wants lighter touch. I think this is an area where agreement can be reached.
item.dc:creator: @SamuelMarcLowe
item.description: Don’t object to principle that trusted traders can be treated differently (has proposed something similar but called an express lane) — disagree on what benefits will be, UK wants next to no controls; EU wants lighter touch. I think this is an area where agreement can be reached.

item.title:
Mainly just gutted that due to “the alphabet” I am 22 places lower than @alanbeattie on this @flexport list.
(But also one place above @scottlincicome)

item.title:

So own up, which one of you was at the IfG last night boring on about rules of origin?

item.title: R to @Scottyb531: The way it’s viewed (other views are available): UK spent whole year threatening to walk away from negotiations, no deal, etc over issues such as fish and level playing field, then right at the last minute accepted compromises that had been in play since March
item.dc:creator: @SamuelMarcLowe
item.description: The way it’s viewed (other views are available): UK spent whole year threatening to walk away from negotiations, no deal, etc over issues such as fish and level playing field, then right at the last minute accepted compromises that had been in play since March
